reviewText: WCW Starcade'93 is a good show topped off with Vader vs Ric Flair.Flair puts on a perfect match as always and Vader plays a great heel in Flair's hometown of Charlotte NC.Also included Steamboat  vs Regal,Rick Rude vs The  Boss(Big Bossman)and an excellent brawl between Dustin(Goldust)Rhodes and  Stunning Steve Austin.
Title: WCW Starrcade '93 VHS

reviewText: 2 Cold Scorpio & Marcus Alexander BagwellvsPaul Roma & "Mr. Wonderful" Paul OrndorfKiller Assasin Gave Scorpio A Headbutt With A Foreign Object In His MaskAwesome KongvsShockmasterShockmaster On A Power SlamTV Title MatchRicky "The Dragon" Steamboatvs"Lord" Steven Regal (C)DRAWTex Slazenger & Shanghi PiercevsCactus Jack & Maxx PayneCactus Jack On A Double Arm DDTU.S. Title Match (2 Out Of 3 Falls)"Stunning" Steve AustinvsDustin Rhodes (C)1) Rhodes Threw Austin Over The Top Rope For A DQ2) Austin Rolled Up RhodesInternational Title MatchBossvs"Ravishing" Rick Rude (C)Rude On A Sunset FlipTag Team Title MatchSting & Road Warrior HawkvsNasty Boys (C)DQ- Missy Hyatt InterferredWorld Title MatchRic FlairvsBig Van Vader (C)Flair Rolled Vader Up
Title: WCW Starrcade '93 VHS

reviewText: This was the 10th anniversary of Starrcade, and just like the first - Ric Flair stole the show.2 Cold Scorpio and Marcus Alexander Bagwell (with Teddy Long) vs. Paul Orndorff and Paul Roma (with the Assassin) Teddy Long proves his worth as a manager - or his lack of worth I should say. The same guy that took Doom to the tag team championship just three years before looks about as useful as Jameson, the nerd that used to appear on WWF Prime Time. Pretty good contest between the newly formed team of Orndorff and Roma and the somewhat established young duo of Bagwell and Scorpio. Orndorff and Roma win at just about the 12 minute mark after the Assassin puts something in his mask and headbutts Scorpio with it. These teams would battle for the next few months with each trading wins.Shockmaster vs. King Kong I'm not sure who the Shockmaster actually fought. Whoever it was, he pinned the wrong member of the Colossal Kongs. I can't believe Harley Race brought the Kongs into WCW to be a dominating force. That's hilarious. Shockmaster, a joke in himself, wins in less than two minutes.WCW World TV Champion Lord Steven Regal vs. Ricky "the Dragon" Steamboat Steamboat, much like Flair later in the show, is contesting for a championship in his home town of Charlotte, NC. Regal had pretty much robbed Steamboat of the TV title a few months earlier at Fall Brawl - and after the two were paired together at Battlebowl in November the feud heated up even more. The two put on a pretty good contest with the result being a 15-minute time limit draw. Although a lot of people hated the old time limit draws, I thought they put a lot more attention on a match that otherwise wouldn't have gained as much heat from the fans. Steamboat vs. Regal is one thing, but having the challenger in complete control when the match only has 45 seconds left adds a lot of suspense to the match.Cactus Jack and Maxx Payne vs. Tex Slazener and Shanghi Pierce (aka the Godwinns) Cactus somehow goes from main eventing against Vader to having to carry Maxx Payne as a tag team partner. Oh well. Jack and Payne go over the more experienced team after about 7 minutes. Cactus and Maxx would go on to feud with the Nasty Boys in January - their feud culiminating in April in a great Chicago Streetfight as part of Spring Stampede.WCW International World Champion Rick Rude vs. the Boss Rude's belt is the NWA title he won from Flair at Fall Brawl. "The British Bulldog" Davey Boy Smith was to have met Rude for the title but unbeknownst to many, he had been fired from the company shortly prior to the show. Rude had attacked Smith during the November Clash of the Champions and the two had started up quite a feud - but when the Bulldog failed to show up to meet Rude during WCW Saturday Night shortly before the PPV - the Boss came out of nowhere and pinned Rude cleanly in a non-title match. It should be noted that the Boss (or the Big Bossman) was the last man to feud with Rude in the WWF and Rude left the company before the feud could finish. Rude takes the win at the 9 minute mark. The Boss goes on to mediocrity against Vader."Stunning" Steve Austin (with Col. Parker) vs. U.S. Champion Dustin Rhodes Best 2 out of 3 Falls These two lions had wars on many pay-per-views from 1991 to this date, and like all the other matches - this one was very heated. Rhodes and Austin had been feuding over the US title since their Halloween Havoc match two months prior. Austin had busted Rhodes' head open during Battlebowl in November. The first fall is awarded pretty sloppy - as Rhodes sends Austin into Col. Parker on the apron - Austin goes over the top rope to the floor and Rhodes loses on DQ. The challenger gets busted open pretty badly but comes back to get a tainted pinfall on Rhodes two minutes later to win the championship.Sting and Road Warrior Hawk vs. WCW Tag Team Champions Nasty Boys (with Missy Hyatt) Obviously WCW had little competition for the tag team champions if they had to bring in Hawk to tag with Sting. Very long match that nearly hits the 30-minute time limit. Sting and Hawk execute the Doomsday Device on Knobbs but Missy Hyatt makes the save for her team (and pops out of her bra in doing so). Challengers win on a DQ.Ric Flair vs. WCW Champion Big Van Vader (with Harley Race) 10 years prior, Flair had met and defeated Harley Race at Starrcade 83 to end Race's last reign as world champion. Now he faces Vader for the title. Vader had left a trail of broken bones in his path over the years of 92 and 93. He took credit for Ron Simmons' shoulder injury, Cactus Jack's head trauma, Sting's broken ribs, running Nikita Koloff out of wrestling, breaking the back of a young wrestler in a sqash match, and most recently attacking Sid Vicious and sending him out of WCW (well, Sid was actually fired for the stabbing incident in the UK but Vader did injure Sid in Sid's last WCW TV appearance). Flair, who many felt was past his prime at the time, was a major underdog against the dominating force of Vader. Flair had put his career on the line and said that if he couldn't win the world title in Charlotte - then he would retire. After 21 minutes of action, Flair clips Vader in the knee and rolls him up for the shocking victory and his 11th world title win. Very good match with lots of psychology. Vader was a fantastic big man and had some incredible stamina for his size (when he was healthy). After the match, Flair is congratulated by both Sting and Ricky Steamboat (two men that would contend for his title in the coming year).Very emotional main event and a good undercard. Recommended tape.
Title: WCW Starrcade '93 VHS

reviewText: I'm going to finish up the year 1993 with the 10th Anniversery of Starrcade. For the 1st time since Starrcade 88 they put on a normal card. Now getting into the backstory which I love to tell. Around this time Dusty Rhodes was removed as the booker Ric Flair became The Booker along with Eric Bischoff running the company. Getting to the angles leading into this show  Ric Flair put his career on the line against The WCW World Heavyweight Champion Big Van Vader. 1993 you know you had some top Pro Athletes either retire or they were rumored to retire but stayed in what ever sport they were in. The whole set up just worked with Ric Flair & Vader. Starrcade in Ric Flair's home town plus having Starrcade in North Carolina again Starrcade should've stayed in the old Mid Alantic Gerogia Championship Wrestling area. Since Vader's push in 1992 he was just unbeatable He beat Sting for The WCW World title in July of 92 at The GAB. He lost it to Ron Simmons about a month later. At Halloween Havoc he injured Nikita Koloff so bad that he had to retire. He beat Simmons before 92 went out to regain the title. Sting tried but was unsucessful to win The World title back until March of 93 in Europe he won it back but it didn't last cause 7 days later Vader won it back for the 3rd titme. Vader had Cactus Jack carted off in a streatcher & put him out for 5 months. Beat The Brithish Bulldog. Had a great Texas Death Match with Cactus Jack at Halloween Havoc 93. So he's beat or destroyed everyone they put in front of him. Harley Race was his manager & lost The NWA World Heavyweight Championship to Ric Flair in the 1st Starrcade in 83. Harley Race had his own hate for Flair going into this event. The promos were amazing going into this show. On The November 27th episode of WCW Saturday Night Flair said "I'm not the baddest man on the planet but I am the hungerist. I can't stand being 2nd best. I might be a little sore after what you did a Battlebowl but when your career is on the line you either get up & get ready or you get out."  The next week you had Vader cut a promo he said "The contract has been signed your name is on the dotted line! Every second of every day every hour of the day it draws near your careet is coming to an end to the greatest wrestler in the history or Professional Wrestling! I havoe NO FEAR & I Feel NO PAIN! So bring it on in Charlotte North Carolina bring all your famous friends bring Laurence Taylor bring Michael Jordan bring The Mayor so I can humilate you. Do you know how many trophies I have on my wall Sting Nikita Koloff Ron Simmons Cactus Jack & the man that though he ruled the world Sid Vicious! Come prepared for war!" Later on in the show Flair cut a promo he told why he's is doing this "It started in 1975 October 4th to be exact. I was in an airplane that crashed over Willmington North Carolina. In that Airplane 1 of the biggest names in our sport never walked again his name is John Valintine. The Piolet died. I was carted off to the hospital! The Doctor looked me in the eye & said I'm sorry but you will never wrestle again. 18 years later $10 million later! 10 World Championships later Ric Flair is looking a 400 pound monster in the eyes not the greatest wrestler I've ever competed against! But maybe the greatest athlete in our sport today. I'm lookinng at him like I looked my Mother my Father my Wife & kids & Fifi I want this 1 for me! There's a lot of people that think I don't have it anymore. They say I have the nerve to compare myself with the likes of Jordan & Montana. I've got the creditals to compare. In 1984 Texas Stadium me & kid who is in the ground now! I lost but I lived to wrestle & I won it back! Me & Dusty Rhodes 1986 50,000 at The Ornge Bowl! 19,000 filled a smoke filled arena San Munchnick retired on this night who did they pick to wrestle in The Main Event The Nature Boy & The America Dream! It's me it's my life  & Vader I will show you why I am the greatest wrestler of all time." The following week on WCW Saturday Night Vader cut a promo he said "Flair listen to me I'm talking dead at you I'm calling you out! You must be the dumbest man alive or the most desperate! Which ever 1 Vader don't give a s  h  i  t! You put your name on the dotted line against The King Of The Rocky Mountains the man that definitly rules the world! The WCW Heavyweight Champion Of The World! This is the worst mistake of your career & your last! You compare yourself to Joe Montana & Michael Jordan! You're not man enough to stand toe to toe with Big Van Vader! Flair cut a promo in response later on  he said " You know there are times in my life where I just want to cry. Cause People don't belive! 18 years ago a plane crashed 1 man died 2 never walked ever again & 1 went on to become The Worlds Champion 10 times! Respect for that no says Big Van Vader the 400 pound awesome phsyical specimen the greatest athlete in our sport. That's just great I just broke down. I got no where to go I'm old lonesome Ric Flair wrong! My 5 year old son Daddy you're the greatest & that's all I need! I don't need yoy to love me I don't need you to respect me for who I am but when there's 30 million wrestling fans who have seen me bleed, sweat & pay the price for 1 word respect & being the best you can be. Everyday day of my life. So Starrcade I know I am emotional about it but Charlotte is my home town I'm walking that aisle. I'll style I'll profile with tears in my eyes! So if you want me you got to come get me!" The next week on WCW Saturday Night they ran a great featurette on Flair's career from the 1st Starrcade his JCP  career WCW, WWF & when he came back to WCW. Mike Fratello & Brad Daughtery were featured in this video. Charles Barkley when he was with The Phoenix Suns gave his support to Ric Flair. Vader came out during this episode to cut another promo on Ric Flair he said "Vader understands that you own a very nice Gold's Gym in Charlotte NC! After Starrcade you can be there full time & tell the people how it used to be! Bring all your famous friends. Bring your little boy the 1 that says he believe's in you!" On The December 19th episode of The Main Event Flair cut a promo he said "The whole world has siad I have bitten off more than I can chew. I'm prepared if I lose. To make it clear this is not about making the Hal Of Fame cause I'm already there this is to make sure I am on the 1st ballot. If you think that you're going to walk all over me your wrong." On The Christmas Night episode of WCW Saturday Night Flair made it known that he was prepared at any lenght to get the match at Starrcade. I made it known if I do not win the title not by DQ  but win the title I would retire. This isn't another Match for The World Heavyweight Championship it's something that I've got to prove to myself. I wake up everyday wanting to be the man. Gene Okerland asked him what if he loses. Flair said then I can say that I have given everything that I have the past 20 years. But if the dice do roll my way at Starrcade & they have a lot of times. Then on New Year's Eve if I'm The Champion I'll tell you what the next milestone is. But Monday Vader you have a date with destiny. So back at Clash Of Champions 25 there was a lot of backstae commotion with The British Bulldog & Rick Rude. Bulldog challenged Rude for The WCW World International Heavyweight Championship. Bulldog also teamed with Sting on this night to face The Nasty Boys for The WCW World Tag Team Championship. Rude attacked Bulldog during the match which helped The Nasty Boys retain. On The December 4th episode of  WCW Saturday Night it was announced that Rude will defend the title against The British Bulldog at Starrcade. On The following week on WCW Saturday Night Rude said I'll face The British Bulldog any place anytime anywhere. Bulldog came out & agreed to face him. On The December 12th episode of WCW World Wide Rude was mad that he wasn't in Jesse Ventura's arm wrestling tournament. He got in a fight with The Bulldog he took his arm & slammed it on the arm wrestling table. The British Bulldogo was fired Eric Bischoff felt he no showed too much even though in his contract it said he could work Japan. But that was a Bill Watts deal Eric Bischoff didn't care.  So The Big Boss Man from The WWF  came down & beat Rude in a non title match. Who is now going by The Boss. On The Christmas episode of WCW Saturday Night Rude said I don't care who I face. Meanwhile Sting teamed up with Road Warrior Hawk to face The Nasty Boys at Starrcade for The Tag Team titles. At The Battlebowl Pay Per View Steve Austin rammed Dustin Rhodes head into the ring post. That busted him open. Colonel Parker got Austin another shot at The US Championship this time it would be 2 out of 3 falls. On The December 4th episode Colonel Parker tried to pay Dustin Rhodes off & give Austin The US title. Of course he refused. On The December 18th episode Austin attacked Rhodes after a match. Brian Pillman returned & made the save. There was suppose to be a match at Starrcade between Arn Anderson & Paul Roma Arn was out due to the stabbing incident that took place. They had to write Arn out & still turn Roma heel in a tag team match with Erik Watts he turned & joined with Paul Orndorff to form Pretty Wounderful. I know this had to be a long backstory but I like telling it. Anyway the buyrate was a 0.55 that is up from last year's 0.50.Date December 27, 1993Attendance 8,200Venue Independence ArenaAwesome opening with the photo's of Flair through the years. It shows wht he has to face. Tony Schiavone & Jesse Ventura open the show Jesse is wearing a suit & tie. They showed where Harley Race & Vader came to the arena earlier in the day. Vader was carrying on about were going to have a party tonigh. NO PAIN! Harley told him to stay focused. Ric Flair had yet to arrive. They show Ric Flair leaving his house where his Wife Beth is there along with son David & his other son Reid & his youngest Daughter I don't know her name. As Flair & Okerland leave he says it seems that there is so much emotion in there. Flair said that their worried. Okerland said who's family wouldn't be. Flair said I'm worried too but for different reasons. Okerland said you've seen what tis monster Vader has done the past couple of years. Flair responded by saying I knew what Vader was about before I even signed the contract. I need this 1 for myself.Pretty Wounderful Paul Orndorff & Paul Roma with The Assassin Def 2 Cold Scorpio & Marcus Alexander Bagwell with Theodre Long ** & half stars Theodore Long was presented The Manager Of The Year trophy. 1 Harley Race should've won it. 2 You had Long's team drop the match after winning the award. Decent opener though. 2 Cold & Bagwell did a lot of good tag team work. Orndorff & Roma had been teaming for about a week or more. The heel team got some help from The Assassin Pretty Wounderful pick up the win. They go back to the limo where Okerland tells Flair if the reality of the match has set in. Flair said that I don't want to think about losing. So let's keep an upbeat scale.The Shockmaster Def Awesome Kong with King Kong DUD wtf was this doing on the biggest show of the year. Not much to this match.Tony Schiavone confirms that The Boss will be going for The World Internation Championship. Ric Flair has arrived at the arena.WCW Televison ChampionshipChampion Steven Regal with Sir William vs Ricky Steamboat went the time limit *** a good match. This wasn't as good as their match at Fall Brawl but this was good. Jesse Ventura says that the match with Flair & Vader is a win win for Ric Flair cause if he wins he's The World Champion for the 11th time if he loses retirement ain't that bad.Cactus Jack & Max Payne Def Tex Slazenger & Shanghai Pierce * & quarter of a star Cactus Jack & Max Payne were a new team Max Payne had recently turned face around Battlebowl Cactus Jack became his spirital advisor. Gene Okerland interviewed Kyle Petty what an awesome head of hair is all I can say. He hopes Flair wins.2 our of 3 falls for The WCW United States ChampionshipSteve Austin with Colonel Parker Def Champion Dustin Rhodes ** & half starsDuring the match Tony Schiavone said that you're looking at the men that will dominate WCW for the rest of the decade. Well that was until Hogan & Friends ruined those plans. Austin did a nice blade job. Colonel Parker was hurt during the match. The lights started messing upRhodes was disqualified for throwing Austin over the top ropeAustin got the 2nd fall to win the title a dedent matchWCW World International Heavyweight ChampionshipChampion Rick Rude Def The Boss * & a quarter of a star a poor match but it had it's momentsWCW World Tag Team ChampionshipSting & Road Warrior Hawk Def Champions The Nasty Boys Jerry Sags & Knobs with Missy Hyatt by disqualification The Nasties keep the titles. * & 3 quarters of a star.If you thought I complained too much about the 26 minute match at Fall Brawl this is 30 MINUTES! It's ok Sting & Hawk did what they could but it's 30 minutes & The Nasty Boys can't go 30 minutes. They could've just done a 15 or 20 minute match. The DQ finish was lame. This would also be Missy Hyatt's last WCW PPV. Cause when she got involved in the match herb  oo  bs became exposed & somebody put a blown up picture of it in The CNN offices & when she complained she was fired by Eric Bischoff.Getting to the big match of the showWCW World Heavyweight ChampionshipRic Flair Def Champion Big Van Vader with Harley Race **** & 3 quarters of a starVader the ultimate bad guy in WCW not Hollywood Hogan. Flair could do no wrong on this night. Flair was about 44 or 45 at the time. A lot of people felt he was too old at this time even. But he proved  to his old boss Jim Herd why he is a legend & why Herd is a bad memory in the business. He proved to Shane Douglas why he belonged in the main event & why he would never be in his position. 1 of Flair's most important title wins as important as his win in the 1st Starrcade or his win over Steamboat in 89.Vader was mad backstage he was trashing his locker room. Flair came back out on the ramp for the fans. Backstage his Wif Beth was there his Sons David & Reid his Daughter Megan & his other Dauhter I forgot her name. Ric Flair said that Vader was a great champion. Beth said that she was happy that this happend in Flair's home town of Charlotte. Sting came & gave his props to Flair along with Ricky Steamboat. Flair closed by saying that I have been a very fortunate man. Okerland said we have been very fortunate to have a man like you in this sport. The unercard was decent the main event was epic the only matches I didn't care for was probably The Shockmaster match maybe Rude vs The Boss. This to me though was the last Starrcade that felt like a real Starrcade.Suberbrawl IV reviewThis event was never released on home video by Turner Home Entertainment or The WWE. For whatever reason. I didn't think it was that bad of a show especially compared to the s  *  *  t WCW would put on in 1995 like Superbrawl V or Uncensored 1995. Superbrawl IV  was released however in Germany so if you want you can go to Amazon Germany & buy it if you want. Or find a bootleg seller that sells old wrestling shows that would be your best bet. I always love to fill in the backstory for all these old Pay Per Views getting into it. At The Clash Of Champions 26 a new Commissoner was named for WCW in Nick Bockwinkle & Bobby Hennan joined Tony Schiavone for commentary for now on yeah Jesse Ventura was on his way out of WCW. On The January 15th episode of WCW World Wide the main event was announced for Superbrawl IV Vader got his rematch for The WCW World Heavyweight Championship in a Thunder Cage. Vader had been going around & saying that Flair's win at Starrcade was a fluke & a Christmas Miracle. In the meantime at The Clash Of Champions 26 Ric Flair teamed up with Sting to face Rick Rude & Big Van Vader in a tag team elimination match. Vader just destroyed Ric Flair during the match he gave him 2 or 3 superplexes Vader was going to finish off Flair with a chair but Commissoner Bockwinkle stepped in both Vader & Flair were counted out & Sting & Rude finished up the match & they had a good match with Sting winning. On The January 29th episode of WCW Saturday Night Commissoner Bockwinkle held a press conferance where he canceled the match until April. Vader & Harley Race barged in Vader threatened Flair he threatened Flair's wife he even told her if she wanted a real man. He flipped over a table he started threatening Steamboat & his family. Bockwinkle fined Vader for $25,000 for his actions. At the end of the show Vader said Flair's family or friends won't be safe until he got his match. The following week on WCW Saturday Night Vader jumped Ricky Steamboat & he wouldn't stop punching him. Later on in the show Ric Flair called in he demanded to be put back in The Thundercage match before anybody else was attacked by Vader he also said that if I can't be put back in then I will be in the building on The 20th. Bockwinkle gave him till the Monday to give them a doctors note. The next week on WCW Saturday Night Bockwinkle annouced we got the note Monday afternoon so the match is back on. The Boss was put in the match as a Special Guest Referee. Flair cut a promo on this episode he said I am scared anybody in their right mind would be too. It's not about making the hall of fame cause I am already their so I don't care if you put me out of wrestling. It's got to end. On The WCW Saturday Night before Superbrawl IV Vader was squashing a few jobbers. Flair cut a great promo he said how you might be right that Starrcade was Christmas Miricle but it was my moment & you can't take that away from me right now you only know the man & if I can beat you at Superbrawl then you will know who the man really is. As well he said that my family & friends won't be there just you & me this will be the end. On The January 1st episode Sting took on Steve Austin Brian Pillman wanted to fight Colonel Parker in a match where the loser has to wear a chicken suit. Sting was disqualified when Brian Pillman interfered & went after Austin. The following week on WCW Saturday Night Pillman & Sting teamed up to face Rick Rude & Steve Austin. Rude & Austin won the match. On The January 15th episode of WCW World Wide Brian Pillman teamed up with Dustin Rhodes faced Rick Rude & Steve Austin that match went to a no contest. On The January 22nd episode of WCW Saturday Night Brian Pillman defeated Steve Austin in a non title match. At The Clash Of Champions 26 Pillman defeated Colonel Parker then on the January 29th episode of WCW Saturday Night Colonel Parker had to wear a chicken suit. Colonel Parker was humilated so he got Rick Rude & Paul Orndorff to team up with Steve Austin & Brian Pillman got Sting & Dustin Rhodes as partners for a 6 man tag team Thunder Cage match. On The January 8th episode of WCW World Wide The Nasty Boys attacked Cactus Jack & Max Payne cause the challenged them for The WCW World Tag Team Championship. On The January 23rd episode of The Main Event The Nasty Boys attacked them again but Cactus Jack & Max Payne fought them off. At The Clash Of Champions 26 Cactus Jack & Max Payne beat The Nasty Boys in a non title match they got a shot for The WCW World Tag Team Championship at Superbrawl IV. Also after that match Missy Hyatt was left all alone in the ring Cactus Jack & Max Payne both kissed Missy. This was around the time Missy was on her way out. On The Febuary 5th episode of WCW Saturday Night Arn Anderson returned to the ring he also got a shot at The WCW Televison Championship at Superbrawl. Diamond Dallas Page returned to WCW on The January 9th episode of The Main Event & he got in a small feud with Terry Taylor. Michael Hayes returned to the ring with Johnny B Badd & they formed a tag team. On The Febuary 19th episode of WCW World Wide Hayes turned on Badd so it looked like Hayes was going to return to the ring again so we thought I'll get to that. The buyrate was a 0.50 same as last years Superbrawl.Date February 20, 1994Attendance 7,600Venue Gray Civic CenterCity Albany GAStarting off we have Bobby Hennan say that he thinks there will be a new World Champion & that we have heard our last WOOO! The opener was suppose to be suppose to be Johnny B Badd vs Michael PS Hayes. But he had a really bad back injury & never wrestled again & he was on his way out of WCW. Hayes said he fell down a set of stairs Hayes was in a wheelchair & you had Jimmy "Jam" Garivn return to WCW. Hayes & Garvin tried kissing Bockwinkle'sa s s. Bockwinkle said there was still a contract on The Freebirds so Garvin would have to wrestle later in the show.Harlem Heat Booker T & Stevie Ray Def Thunder & Lightning 1& half starsBobby Hennan called Thunder & Lightning Batman & Robin. A camera cut to Ric Flair's dressing room he was there along with Arn Anderson & Ricky Steamboat. This match was nothing special mediocore WCW was pushing this Thunder & Lightning team & they weren't ready at all.Gene Okerland was in the back there were cops there to stop Vader from getting a hold of Flair before the match."Jungle" Jim Steel Def The Equalizer half a star in a bad & I mean bad match. "Jungle" Jim Steel was another guy who WCW was pushing like they did with Charlie Norris, Ice Train & The Shockmaster it was just another dud.Gene Okerland interviewed Ricky Steamboat he wants to face whoever is The WCW World Champion after tonight. Ric Flair has promised him a shot if he retains. Bockwinkle was there he said he deserves a shot since he is a former NWA World Champion.Terry Taylor Def Diamond Dallas Page with a Diamond Doll ** Taylor got a nice pop an ok match.Gene Okerland interviewed some German announcerJohnny B Badd Def Jimmy "Jam" Garvin * & 3 quarters of a star an ok match Schiavone said it was odd seeing Jimmy Garvin with short hair yeah look at him today. Hennan said that he didn't think that Okerland was bald he just has a wide part. Jimmy Garvin beat up Johnny B Badd after the match that made no sense cause this was a 1 night apperance for Garvin & Hayes was on his way out.Okerland tried to get an interview with Big Van Vader he was tearing his locker room apart he threw a chair at the door & yelled at him no interviews & to go away.WCW Televison ChampionshipChampion Steven Regal with Sir William Def Arn Anderson **** & half stars Arn got huge pop Regal was very much over as the heel. Most TV title matches are 15 minutes not 30. The under card was prettys h it t y I guess Arn went up to Regal & said hey this Pay Per View had some bad matches lets go out there & tear the house down for 30 minutes they did & they had ah e l l of a match. It was great I bet if anybody attend this show live or watched it on Pay Per View they were expecting Arn to win the TV title. Only they didn't know he had to job cause Eric Bischoff wanted to punish him over the stabbing incident cause he fired both Sid & Arn originally I'm sure Arn told Ric Flair who was the booker at the time hey I'm cool with jobbing to Regal. Cause I'm sure they saw Regal was a skilled wrestler & still is.WCW World Tag Team ChampionshipCactus Jack & Max Payne Def Champions The Nasty Boys Brian Knobs & Jerry Sags by disqualification ** & a quarter of a star a half decent match.I got to admit that Brian Knobs coming down with that guitar was funny. This match was a halfway decent match. Mick Foley & Max Payne always made The Nasty Boys look better than they were. Cause I do consider them the worst workers ever. But when they worked guys like The Steiner Brothers or Cactus Jack & Max Payne those were some of their better matches. The matches The Nasty Boys had at the next 2 Pay Per View were even better than this.Mean Gene interviewed Ric Flair he brought up Hulk Hogan Flair said he is focused on Vader & don't worry I'm not reviewing anything past Slamboree 1994 I know I won't review late 94-mid 96 aka The Hogan & friends era unless people ask for then yeah I will. Ayway Flair said that he's got to get through this obstacle 1 more time I will face a man who I consider to be the best wrestler I ever competed against & that's Ricky Steamboat. Arn & Steamboat have Flair's back.Double Thundr Cage1st Thundr Cage 6 man tag team matchStingDustin Rhodes& Brian PillmanDefRick RudeSteve Austin& Paul Orndorff** & half stars Sting got a massive pop as always. There was this girl in the crowd that had her face painted like The Stingers Hennan said that was her regular make up she's won Miss Albany the past 6 years in a row. This match had some good bumps it was decent. After the match they were all still fighting Rude was trying to escape Rude slammed the door in Sting's face & gave him The Rude Awakening on the floor.2nd Thunder CageWCW World Heavyweight ChampionshipChampion Ric Flair Def Big Van Vader with Harley Race ** & half starsThe Boss was The Special Guest RefereeThis match is no where near as epic as there Starrcade match. I have heard that Vader was suppose to win the title back but Flair decided to keep on himself cause he wanted to do another Flair Steamboat match for the next Pay Per View Spring Stampede. Harley Race kept interfering from outside of the cage The Boss was going to handcuff him to the cage Vader attacked him they handcuffed The Boss to the cage Race got the key got in the cage helped Vader double team Flair. Double A & Ricky Steamboat came down to try & help Steamboat tried busting the lock off with a chair. The Boss broke free of form the handcuffs he came in fought off Vader & Race. Flair put The Figure 4 Leg Lock on Vader The Boss called it for Ric Flair so he retained the title. Big Van Vader was extremly mad about it. I guess this was Vince McMahon's inspiration for The Montreal Screw job. Can we call it The Albany Screw job lol.A pretty good Pay Per View but not must see  I will say Arn Anderson vs Steven Regal for The TV Championship was the match of the night though. Page vs Taylor was ok the rest of the undercard was lackluster. The Thunder Cage matches were decent you had a halfway decent match with The Nasty Boys vs Cactus Jack & Max Payne. Don't go out of your way to get this show either find a bootleg seller like I did or watch it on youtube it's on there. Although The World Tag Team title match The 6 Man Thunder Cage & The Boss screwing Vader over those 3 matches set up 3 matches for the next Pay Per View that I will review Spring Stampede a solid PPV's then you have certain Orange Goblin screw everything up.
summary: Starrcade 1993 review 8/10 added bonus review Superbrawl IV 7/10
Title: WCW Starrcade '93 VHS

reviewText: Much better then WWE's WrestleMania 9 of that same year. The best matches were the TV title match between Rick Steamboat & Steven Regal despite the 15 minute draw,the 2 out of 3 falls match for the US championship between Dustin Rhodes & Steve Austin eventhough it was kind of one-sided score-wise not wrestling-wise and the WCW World heavyweight championship match between Vader & Ric Flair which was named Starrcade's number 1 match by wrestling fans everywhere and with good reason becuase the wrestling in that match was much better then in the match between Bret Hart & Yokozuna at the WM9. The Worst match was the match between The Shockmaster & Awesome Kong(The Male one,not female one) which was still better then the ones at WM9 and that's counting the Doink-Crush match. The rest were OK and much better then the crud I had to put up at you-know-where. I give this event a 8 out of 10.
Title: WCW Starrcade '93 VHS

reviewText: Starrcade ended the pitiful WCW year of 1993. The main event ended up being Vader vs. Ric Flair, who substituted for Sid Vicious (and we all know THAT story!). This match was, in a word, awesome! VERY emotional. It was a classic to say the least. Now, as far as the rest of the PPV goes. DUD. Cactus Jack & Maxx Payne carry the Godwinns to a watchable match (but not good). Other than that? Can you say Shockmaster vs. Awesome Kong? I can't recommend this in good concious, but try to catch the Vader/Flair match if you can.
summary: Great main event...and that's about it!
Title: WCW Starrcade '93 VHS

reviewText: Starrcade is supposed to be WCW's biggest pay per view of the year, but somehow, when you watch this tape, you don't get that impression.  As usual, WCW spends all its time building up the main event while neglecting all the other matches.The pay-per-view starts with with Mr. Wonderful getting the win in a decent tag match.  Paul Roma comes up with some interesting selling comments during the match that I particularly liked.  2 Cold Scorpio does some nice moves but of course, he's no Mr. Wonderful.  Manager Teddy Long looked even stupider then than he does now.  Ha ha.Who should come out next for a match but the legendary Shockmaster.  You've got to love these guys who wear hardhats to the ring.  Remember Regal's real man's man gimmick?  Anyway, Shockmaster wins his match in about 30 seconds by beating another huge guy who's just as fat as he is.Next is by far the best match on the card.  Ricky Steamboat against William Regal.  This is one of the best matches I've seen Regal in, and that's saying something.  Of course, Steamboat is no slouch either, and even though these guys wrestle to the time limit, they don't even let a second go to waste (unless you get impatient watching the ring psychology at the beginning that Regal likes to use).  Great, great match.Now we go to Mick Foley's least memorable match ever when he teams up with Maxx Payne to face those guys who were the Godwinns in the WWF.  Don't expect much here.  For some reason when Payne does that Fujiwara Arm Bar move of his, it doesn't seem exciting.  Some guys can pull it off, but when Payne does it, you think, "So what?"Fortunately this match is followed by a pretty good US title match between Dustin Rhodes and Steve Austin.  Two great wrestlers in a two-out-of-three falls match.  Can't go wrong there.  Austin wins the US Title in a big upset.  He pulls the tights to win the second fall, but I don't count it as cheating, because he was close enough to put his feet on the ropes and he didn't bother to do that.Next is Ravishing Rick against the Big Bossman.  Bossman gets cheers from the crowd like crazy.  It's amazing.  I guess there are two reasons for this.  He's real southern (this is WCW), and he's facing a heel that's really over.  Rude takes a nasty backdrop but still manages to win with a sunset flip.  Don't see that too often.  Sunset flips are usually broken with ease when the guy who's pinned uses his calves to smash the pinning guy's face.Okay, so far we've only had a bad Maxx Payne match and a bad Shockmaster match, but that's not too terrible right?  Unfortunately the next match adds to the mediocrity that is Starrcade '93.  The Nasty Boys vs. Hawk and Sting.  There was only really one thing wrong with this match.  It was WAAAAY too long.  The Nasty Boys should never be in a ring for that amount of time.  You know there's a problem when Sting actually has to show some offense during a match to keep the audience awake.  The match ends in a DQ anyway, when Missy disrupts a cover.  The least she could have done was hit somebody.Thank goodness the main event keeps the pay per view from being a total dud.  It's not Flair's best match, and it's not Vader's best match, but it's a fun match to watch.  Vader dominates the match early as Flair screams in pain.  You know, Vader's one of the rare guys who was used better by the WCW than the WWF.  WWF just didn't realize how great of a champion this man was.  He's a big name internationally.  But since he's fat, I guess WWF didn't like that.Flair finally starts winning the match when he cheats and uses a chair.  The Charlotte audience loves this, and I don't blame them.  The match goes on for a little while longer until once again Flair gets a pin literally out of nowhere, and becomes an 11-time world champion.  Talk about saving your pay-per-view from certain death.Flair said he would retire if he lost against Vader.  I wonder if retirement matches were ever credible.  Piper and Savage come immediately to mind.  Yet, I believe Mero and Kevin Sullivan actually went through with their retirements, so you never can tell.Is that David Flair I see staring open-mouthed at the camera in this tape?  You can tell that man has the charisma of a wrestling superstar.Better than a 2006 episode of RAW, but there are definitely better tapes out there.
Title: WCW Starrcade '93 VHS

reviewText: WCW Starrcade 93 was good Flair and Big Van Vader put on a great match for the WCW title, even tho there are some forgetable matches overall a good show.
Title: WCW Starrcade '93 VHS
